alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Middlesex; Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 3:22PM EDT until July 04 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Ocean County in southern New Jersey... East central Mercer County in central New Jersey... Southern Monmouth County in central New Jersey... Southwestern Middlesex County in northern New Jersey... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 322 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Twin Rivers, or 14 miles south of New Brunswick, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Toms River, Lakewood, Jackson, Howell, East Brunswick, Marlboro, Manalapan, Tinton Falls, Jamesburg, Hightstown, Cranbury, Lakehurst, Farmingdale, Roosevelt, Windsor, East Freehold, Six Flags Theme Park, Cedar Glen West, Jacksons Mills and West Freehold. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 8A and 9. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 9 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 98 and 104. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
